title: Quest point cape

properties.value: The Quest point cape can be obtained by players who have completed all quests (excluding miniquests). The cape, along with the quest point hood, can be purchased from the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village for 99,000 coins. Note that while the Wise Old Man will talk about the Quest Point Cape in a Free-to-Play world, you cannot purchase the cape in Free-to-Play worlds. It can only be purchased in Pay-to-Play worlds.

SMW Subobject for UntrimmedHigh Alchemy value: 59400Examine: The cape worn by only the most experienced adventurers.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Quest point capeUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Quest point cape.pngWeight: 0.453Value: 99000Version anchor: UntrimmedRelease date: 18 October 2006Item ID: 9813

The Quest point cape can be obtained by players who have completed all quests (excluding miniquests). The cape, along with the quest point hood, can be purchased from the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village for 99,000 coins. Note that while the Wise Old Man will talk about the Quest Point Cape in a Free-to-Play world, you cannot purchase the cape in Free-to-Play worlds. It can only be purchased in Pay-to-Play worlds.

The cape can teleport players to the Legends' Guild gates an unlimited number of times. This is especially convenient as it is the second closest available teleport to a fairy ring (after POH). Also, players with the maximum number of quest points will find that the prices of dreams in the Nightmare Zone are reduced by 10,000 coins. Performing the quest cape emote in the Wise Old Man's house is also an elite task in the Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.

To trim the cape, all Achievement Diaries must be completed as well, thus earning them the achievement diary cape.

Should a new quest be released, the cape will be unequipped and the player wearing it cannot equip or operate it until the new quest is completed. If the player's inventory is full, the cape will be banked instead. In the event that their inventory and bank are both full, the cape will have to be re-purchased from the Wise Old Man.

This item can be stored in the cape rack of a costume room, as part of the Quest point cape set, along with the hood. Ultimate Ironmen will be unable to retrieve individual pieces until the full set is stored.

As of 26 February 2020, there are 61,766 current members that have obtained the quest point cape.[1]

A player performing the Quest point cape's emote.
The music that plays when you purchase a Cape of Accomplishment

Contents

  • 1 Minimum skill levels
  • 2 Highest skill requirements by quest
  • 3 Quest point cape (t)
  • 4 Changes
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Minimum skill levels[edit | edit source]

The minimum levels required to acquire the quest point cape are:

Total level: 1475
50 50 72
50 70 70
65 70 62
60 60 70
50 70 66
75 60 71
55 69 70
70 70
85 289 ----

Bold text indicates that a temporary boost may be used to reach that level. While players need these levels to acquire the cape, they do not need them in order to wear it.

Note: The noted combat stats only get a player to a combat level of 71, while Dream Mentor requires a combat level of 85. The absolute minimum total level (with maximum boosts and 85 combat) required to complete all quests is 1499.

Note: Although Mining and Woodcutting can be boosted to the highest quest-required level, level 70 unboosted is required in both skills for Song of the Elves. Likewise, although Fishing can be boosted to the highest quest-required level, level 60 unboosted is required for The Fremennik Exiles.

Ironmen may need higher levels in some skills due to item requirements: for example, magic logs are required for Desert Treasure and Mourning's End Part I, and although they can be obtained in numerous ways, each has a high skill requirement or is nonviable for most lower-levelled players. Another example is if players burn the raw karambwan in Tai Bwo Wannai Trio, they will need 65 Fishing to be able to fish another.

Highest skill requirements by quest[edit | edit source]

The quests requiring the highest skill levels, along with the levels required (some without boosts) are:

Skill Level Quest
Agility 70 Song of the Elves
Attack 50 Sins of the Father
Construction 70 Song of the Elves
Cooking 70 Recipe for Disaster (Freeing King Awowogei)
Crafting 70 Monkey Madness II
Defence 65 King's Ransom
Farming 70 Song of the Elves
Firemaking 66 Making Friends with My Arm
Fishing 62 Swan Song
Fletching 60 Sins of the Father
Herblore 70 Song of the Elves
Hitpoints 50 Dragon Slayer II
Hunter 70 Song of the Elves
Magic 75 Dragon Slayer II
Mining 72 Making Friends with My Arm
Prayer 50 The Great Brain Robbery
Ranged 60 Mourning's End Part I
Runecraft 55 The Fremennik Exiles
Slayer 69 Monkey Madness II
Smithing 70 Dragon Slayer II/Song of the Elves
Strength 50 Legends' Quest
Thieving 60 Dragon Slayer II
Woodcutting 71 Grim Tales
Combat level 85 Dream Mentor
Quests 200 Dragon Slayer II

Quest point cape (t)[edit | edit source]

The Quest point cape (t) requires completion of all Achievement Diaries, which significantly increases the minimum requirements from those of the regular untrimmed version. It is also worth noting that the quest point cape is a requirement to complete the Lumbridge & Draynor Elite diary which makes the Quest point cape (t) unobtainable without first obtaining the untrimmed version, making it the only cape of accomplishment in the game where this is the case.

Total level: 1954
50 70 85
76 90 91
70 90 96
70 91 95
85 85 85
96 95 90
91 95 91
78 70
100 289 ----

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 April 2016
(update)

A "Teleport" option was added, granting unlimited teleports to the Legends' Guild.

5 March 2015
(update)

The "Trim" option was added, allowing players to trim or untrim the cape.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The quest point cape was first offered to be trimmable in Old School feature poll 10: New Rewards, where it would become trimmed upon completion of an Endurance dream in the Nightmare Zone minigame.
    • Completing a normal Endurance dream would trim the cape blue, increasing the Defence bonuses from +9 to +11 and giving it a +2 Prayer bonus. This only gained 74% support.
    • Completing a hard Endurance dream would trim the cape red, giving it +1 in all Attack bonuses, in addition to the blue-trimmed cape's bonus increases. This would give the red-trimmed cape identical bonuses to a fire cape (excluding its +4 Strength bonus), but only gained 73% support.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Old School RuneScape. "OSRS Data Stream 2020 - Old School RuneScape's 7th Birthday!." (31m43s), YouTube video. 26 February 2020.

The '''Quest point cape''' can be obtained by players who have completed all [[quests]] (excluding [[miniquests]]). The cape, along with the [[quest point hood]], can be purchased from the [[Wise Old Man]] in [[Draynor Village]] for 99,000 [[coins]]. Note that while the Wise Old Man will talk about the Quest Point Cape in a Free-to-Play world, you cannot purchase the cape in Free-to-Play worlds. It can only be purchased in Pay-to-Play worlds.

The cape can teleport players to the [[Legends' Guild]] gates an unlimited number of times. This is especially convenient as it is the second closest available teleport to a [[fairy ring]] (after [[Player-owned house|POH]]). Also, players with the maximum number of quest points will find that the prices of dreams in the [[Nightmare Zone]] are reduced by 10,000 coins. Performing the quest cape emote in the [[Wise Old Man]]'s house is also an elite task in the [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]].

To trim the cape, '''all''' [[Achievement Diaries]] must be completed as well, thus earning them the [[achievement diary cape]].

Should a new quest be released, the cape will be unequipped and the player wearing it cannot equip or operate it until the new quest is completed. If the player's inventory is full, the cape will be banked instead. In the event that their inventory and bank are both full, the cape will have to be re-purchased from the Wise Old Man.

{{Costume storage|cape rack|Quest point cape set, along with the [[Quest point hood|hood]]|set=true}}

As of 26 February 2020, there are '''61,766''' current members that have obtained the quest point cape.{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=OSRS Data Stream 2020 - Old School RuneScape's 7th Birthday!|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UfB2bBacxJ8&t=31m43s|timestamp=31m43s|date=26 February 2020|site=YouTube|notes=|name=}}

==Minimum skill levels==
The minimum levels required to acquire the quest point cape are:

|Hitpoints = 50

'''Bold''' text indicates that a [[temporary boost]] may be used to reach that level. While players need these levels to acquire the cape, they do not need them in order to wear it.

'''Note:''' The noted combat stats only get a player to a combat level of 71, while [[Dream Mentor]] requires a combat level of 85. The absolute minimum total level (with maximum boosts and 85 combat) required to complete all quests is 1499.

'''Note:''' Although Mining and Woodcutting can be boosted to the highest quest-required level, level 70 unboosted is required in both skills for [[Song of the Elves]]. Likewise, although Fishing can be boosted to the highest quest-required level, level 60 unboosted is required for [[The Fremennik Exiles]].

[[Ironmen]] may need higher levels in some skills due to item requirements: for example, [[magic logs]] are required for [[Desert Treasure]] and [[Mourning's End Part I]], and although they can be obtained in numerous ways, each has a high skill requirement or is nonviable for most lower-levelled players. Another example is if players burn the [[raw karambwan]] in [[Tai Bwo Wannai Trio]], they will need 65 Fishing to be able to fish another.

==Quest point cape (t)==
The '''Quest point cape (t)''' requires completion of all [[Achievement Diaries]], which significantly increases the minimum requirements from those of the regular untrimmed version. It is also worth noting that the quest point cape is a requirement to complete the [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary#Elite|Lumbridge & Draynor Elite diary]] which makes the '''Quest point cape (t)''' unobtainable without first obtaining the ''untrimmed version'', making it the only cape of accomplishment in the game where this is the case.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}

|update = Hell-Rats, Fairy Rings & Perks
|change = A "Teleport" option was added, granting unlimited teleports to the Legends' Guild.

|change = The "Trim" option was added, allowing players to trim or untrim the cape.
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}

==Trivia==
* The quest point cape was first offered to be trimmable in [[Poll:Old School feature poll 10: New Rewards|Old School feature poll 10: New Rewards]], where it would become trimmed upon completion of an Endurance dream in the [[Nightmare Zone]] [[minigame]].
** Completing a normal Endurance dream would trim the cape blue, increasing the Defence bonuses from +9 to +11 and giving it a +2 Prayer bonus. This only gained 74% support.
** Completing a hard Endurance dream would trim the cape red, giving it +1 in all Attack bonuses, in addition to the blue-trimmed cape's bonus increases. This would give the red-trimmed cape identical bonuses to a [[fire cape]] (excluding its +4 Strength bonus), but only gained 73% support.
